channel.title: Firejail profile for Virtualbox
channel.description:
I installed Firejail on Debian host. And apply default Firejail profile for Virtualbox "sudo firecfg". Does applying this profile on virtualbox can mess up with Whonix in some way ? Is it advised to apply profiles like that ?
It's possible that Firejail profile restricts something important for Whonix to work and Whonix starts leaking ip or other leaks happens ? Can profile be harmful for Whonix anonymity ?

item.title: Firejail profile for Virtualbox
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Khabib via Whonix Forum:

I installed Firejail on Debian host. And apply default Firejail profile for Virtualbox “sudo firecfg”.
Does applying this profile on virtualbox can mess up with Whonix in some way ? Is it advised to apply profiles like that ?

It’s possible that Firejail profile restricts something important for Whonix to work and Whonix starts leaking ip or other leaks happens ? Can profile be harmful for Whonix anonymity ?

Unknown. Thinkable.

Read full topic

item.title: Firejail profile for Virtualbox
item.dc:creator: 0brand
item.description:
Khabib:

It’s possible that Firejail profile restricts something important for Whonix to work and Whonix starts leaking ip or other leaks happens ? Can profile be harmful for Whonix anonymity ?

You have nothing to worry about. Firejail will not cause IP leaks regardless if installed on the host OS or Whonix VM

Read full topic

item.title: Firejail profile for Virtualbox
item.dc:creator: TNT_BOM_BOM
item.description:
i have tested that and saw that whonix was working , so i didnt notice any issues before. But its not supported by whonix to work always with sandboxed virtualbox, facing issues is under expected state.

Read full topic
